matchInstance.Title: Joshua to Succeed Moses
Message: Grace to Succeed the Law
The Lord himself goes before you and will be with you;
he will never leave you nor forsake you.
Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged.
discouraged implies that God knows that you will fail along the way to heaven, but God will NEVER forsake you

matchInstance.Title: Law, Punishment, Grace
Message: Law, Punishment, Grace
Moses represents Law; Elijah represents Judgement; Jesus represents Grace
Among the three, Jesus,the son of God is greatest, others are only servants
Servants can not live in the house forever, but only the son
and only the son can inherit all the goods things from God
Grace is by love, not by law
(Exodus 21:1-6) God send his son Jesus on Earth
Jesus serve us as a servant (Mark 10:45), yet, he have choice to leave (Exodus 21:1-6)
Jesus love his church, so he want to be servant forever and take the cross for our sin
Jesus take up our cross for us is by God's will and the love of Jesus on us
By his Grace, mountain will move, your obstacles will parish, by your faith, so take a rest
Peter motives are good, want people think that Jesus will pay taxes, but he ignores the fact that Jesus is bigger than Moses (Law)
James and John motive are good, want Jesus to be accept and be glorified, but they ignore the fact that Jesus is bigger than Elijah (Judgement)
We need to see what Jesus truly is
God himself pays for our dept with the blood of Jesus
So that we are free=]
With the heart to glorified Jesus, require knowing that Jesus is the Grace of God
====== Grace has come ==========
God doesn't require you to do this thing right and that thing right to earn his approval, like Moses, because Jesus Christ has fulfilled the law
After all, there are no prophecy for judgement, only prophecy to encourage us to come close to him, and only correction towards Jesus
Jesus can heal the sick without getting sick,
he died on the cross, so that you can earn righteousness through him
This work can only be done by God, all servants like Moses, Elijah, their work only prepares for the true work from God
So every ministry work from man can almost prepare for God, only the work of God will last and succeed
Yet, Jesus will never leave you nor forsake you, both your life and your ministry

matchInstance.Title: Servant and Son
Message: (Matthew 20:11) When they (servants) received it, they began to grumble against the landowner
We live for God, Not Work for God
We inherit the Kingdom of God with all the Good things within, such as life and Joy
We will always eat at God's table (2 Samuel 9:10)
But those whom treat himself under the law, should act like servant (Ziba), and work for those whom enjoy the Grace of God (2 Samuel 9:9-10)
Have Faith and have sight and take the Grace that we do not deserve
Can you picture yourself rejoice in heaven? you will rejoice in heaven as it is on earth
Give Thanks to God by your heart, not by work and take rest, God will do the rest
Servants grumble, Son take rest
====== Enjoy, not work (2 Samuel 9:13) =====
(2 Samuel 9:13) So Mephibosheth (You) lived in Jerusalem (heaven),
for he ate always at the king’s table => (Always enjoy all the goodness from God).
Now he was lame in both his feet. => (Even you are lame, don't worry, you can always eat and enjoy, but not work anymore)
Be the Son of God, not the servant of anything

matchInstance.Title: Jesus told him, 'Don’t be afraid; just believe.' (Mark 5:36)
Message: So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God.  I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand. (Isaiah 41:10)
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me. (Psalm 23:4)
The Lord is my light and my salvation—whom shall I fear?  The Lord is the stronghold of my life—of whom shall I be afraid? (Psalm 27:1)
I prayed to the Lord, and he answered me.  He freed me from all my fears. (Psalm 34:4)
The angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear him, and he delivers them. (Psalm 34:7)
When I am afraid, I put my trust in you. (Psalm 56:3)

'Because he loves me,' says the LORD, 'I will rescue him; I will protect him, for he acknowledges my name. He will call upon me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him. With long life will I satisfy him and show him my salvation. (Psalm 91:14-16)
When anxiety was great within me, your consolation brought joy to my soul. ~ (Psalm 94:19)
An anxious heart weighs a man down, but a kind word (Its beautiful, take some rest) cheers him up. ~ (Proverbs 12:25)
But now, this is what the Lord says…Fear not, for I have redeemed you; I have summoned you by name; you are mine. ~ (Isaiah 43:1)
Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be terrified; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go. (Joshua 1:9)
Tell everyone who is discouraged, Be strong and don’t be afraid! God is coming to your rescue… (Isaiah 35:4)
Cast your cares on the Lord and he will sustain you; he will never let the righteous fall. (Psalm 55:22)
Be strong and courageous.  Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the Lord your God goes with you; he will never leave you nor forsake you. (Deuteronomy 31:6)

For I am the Lord, your God, who takes hold of your right hand and says to you, Do not fear; I will help you.  Do not be afraid, for I myself will help you,' declares the Lord, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel. (Isaiah 41:13-14)
God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble. Psalm 46:1
The Lord is with me; I will not be afraid.  What can man do to me?  The Lord is with me; he is my helper. (Psalm 118:6-7)
Fear of man will prove to be a snare, but whoever trusts in the Lord is kept safe. (Proverbs 29:25)
Do not be afraid of them; the Lord your God himself will fight for you. (Deuteronomy 3:22)
For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of a sound mind. ~ (2 Timothy 1:7)
Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own. (Matthew 6:34)
Humble yourselves, then, under God’s mighty hand, so that he will lift you up in his own good time.  LEAVE ALL your worries with him, because he cares for you. (1 Peter 5:6-7)

Do not worry about your life, what you will eat; or about your body, what you will wear.  Life is more than food, and the body more than clothes.  Consider the ravens: They do not sow or reap, they have no storeroom or barn; yet God feeds them. And how much more valuable you are than birds!  Who of you by worrying can add a single hour to his life?  Since you cannot do this very little thing, why do you worry about the rest? (Luke 12:22-26)
Immediately he spoke to them and said, 'Take courage! It is I. Don’t be afraid.' Mark 6:50

He got up, rebuked the wind and said to the waves, “Quiet! Be still!” Then the wind died down and it was completely calm.  He said to his disciples, “Why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith? (Mark 4:39-40)
Peace is what I leave with you; it is my own peace that I give you. I do not give it as the world does. Do not be worried and upset; do not be afraid. ~ (John 14:27)
There is no fear in love. But perfect love drives out fear, because fear has to do with punishment. The one who fears is not made perfect in love. ~ (1 John 4:18)
But even if you suffer for doing what is right, God will reward you for it. So don’t worry or be afraid of their threats. (Peter 3:14)
Then he placed his right hand on me and said: 'Do not be afraid. I am the First and the Last.' (Revelation 1:17)
Jesus told him, 'Don’t be afraid; just believe.' (Mark 5:36)

And I am convinced that nothing can ever separate us from God’s love. Neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither our fears for today nor our worries about tomorrow—not even the powers of hell can separate us from God’s love.' (Romans 8:38-39)
The Lord your God is in your midst, A victorious warrior. He will exult over you with joy, He will be quiet in His love, He will rejoice over you with shouts of joy. (Zephaniah 3:17)

Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God.  And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus. ~ (Philippians 4:6-7)

matchInstance.Title: In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world.(John 16:33)
Message: Jesus once said 'In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world.'
Jesus do not pray that we leave this world, Jesus once Pray to God :'My prayer is not that you (God) take them out of the world but that you protect them from the evil one.'(John 17:15)
Do not be afraid, you worm Jacob, little Israel, do not fear, for I myself will help you,” declares the Lord, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.(Isaiah 41:13-14)
The Jews (whom believe in Christ) struck down all their enemies with the sword, killing and destroying them, and they did what they pleased to those who hated them.(Esther 9:5)
From the book of Esther and Job, we are here on earth to suffer for as a greater reward is prepared by God

Let's be humble and let God lead our way to the greater peace, for God knows how we will react, and lead us not in to temptation and deliver us from evil, and will lead us to victory against our own heart and indestructible joy.
Therefore do not judge, either your action/thoughts/situation/past/future or other people's action/thoughts/situation/past/future any more. Rest in peace let God save you in the name of Christ.

'Because he loves me,' says the LORD, 'I will rescue him; I will protect him, for he acknowledges my name. He will call upon me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him. With long life will I satisfy him and show him my salvation. (Psalm 91:14-16)
Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls (Matthew 11:29)
Jesus overcome the world, that includes your trouble, your sin, all the trouble in the world, and the world itself

matchInstance.Title: Do not be harsh on yourself, instead believe in Jesus only
Message: Your regret is equivalence saying 'I don't trust in you, God. My mistake/sin is greater than you, God'
Regret growth from your pride, be humble and rest and believe in God
God show his love to you through the blood of his only son
But as for me, I watch in hope for the LORD, I wait for God my Savior; my God will hear me.(Micah 7:7)
Jesus replied, “No one who puts a hand to the plow and looks back is fit for service in the kingdom of God(Luke 9:62)
Let Jesus be the center of all things, and let him show you his love to you is more than your pass, your future and all that regarding you
In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world.(John 16:33)
Jesus overcome the world, that includes your trouble, your sin, all the trouble in the world, and the world itself

matchInstance.Title: Why the disciple that Jesus loved is written in John as 'the disciple that Jesus loved'
Message: Focus on pleasing Jesus your God will free you from this world
Jesus does not belong to the authority in this world
Authority in this world will not love you, as love only comes from God
What you need is love, do not seek love in this world
Seek for Jesus, and you will find love and be loved
the disciple that Jesus love is not given a specific name in the Bible
For me I think the Holy Spirit wants you to know 'the disciple that Jesus loved' represent you
You can only find love in God because God is love. So no matter what you do, focus in Jesus

matchInstance.Title: No one can obey the law except Jesus, yet he did not enjoy the world, so that we can
Message: We ALL are sinner, we ALL sin against God
We have sin in our thoughts and
However, to the one who does not work, but believes in Him who justifies the wicked, his faith is credited as righteousness (Romans 4:5)
Hypothesis is different from faith
faith is 'logizomai' which means accounting in hebrew
In the cross, he call God his God (which Jesus always call ), so that we can call him as father
When he shout 'finished' on the cross, it means none of the bad things comes from judgement would not aims at you
the Judgement come to Jesus, and Jesus bear it on the cross

matchInstance.Title: Why the truth is NOT religion, take rest and believe, God will makes you perfect, but NEVER demand you to be righteous
Message: Abraham lied two times about the SAME thing in Gensis TWO times (Genesis 12:10-20), (Genesis 15:6)
Grace can NEVER be earn, but through receiving through believe
...Do not be afraid, Abram (believes in Him(God) who justifies the wicked). I am your shield, your very great reward.(Genesis 15:1)
But God is righteous, How can he justifies the wicked? Because he bears the consequence of the sin through his son Jesus Christ
God will guide your mind to be like to be like him, so do not be afraid, God is your shield against Judgement, God is your very great reward
There is certainly Judgement as proclaim by religion, but Jesus Christ has taken the punishment (death) from you

matchInstance.Title: Take rest and let God do the rest
Message: Take rest and let God do the rest
Hallelujah!

matchInstance.Title: The Lamp, Its beautiful
Message: Jesus is the center of all the things you do
